column4: hey i'm trying to use a guide to speed up ubuntu, and it says to use sudo tune2fs -o journal_data_writeback /dev/''yourdrive''
what do i put in place of ''yourdrive''?
Just because you can, doesn't mean you should. Is there any particular reason you want to "tune" ubuntu?
Extraordinary claims require extraordinary proof. If it wasn't implemented in Ubuntu, that was for a reason.
